HeadTitle: These maps show the evoloution of depression and prescription data from GP surgery reports to NHS Digtial 2012-2022
SubTitle1: Choose one of the experiment to see the results.

DPR1.mp4.Title: Depression Prevalence (DPR1)
DPR1.mp4.Paragraph: Depression Prevelance appears to be steadily increasing in clusters that are also expanding in size over time

DPR2.mp4.Title: Depression Growth (DPR2)
DPR2.mp4.Paragraph: However, growth is happening in bursts seemingly randomly across the map

PPR1.mp4.Title: Prescription Prevalence for Greater London (PPR1)
PPR1.mp4.Paragraph: This is the number of patients recieving prescription for depression divided by the number of people attending GP practices in each LSOA

DPR1_PPR3_Ratio.mp4.Title: Items Per Patient
DPR1_PPR3_Ratio.mp4.Paragraph: Data contains both population and patient prevelance, the intention is to pick one or the other (probably patient-prevelance because this relates more to the prescriptions,

DGD1.mp4.Title: DGD1 Prescription Prevalence and Growth for Greater London
